conclusion: Determine the refractive index of the transparent object using given conditions.
The semi-cylindrical object has a radius R.
The light enters along the axis OA and reaches point C at a distance of sqrt(3)/3 R from O.
The critical angle for total internal reflection occurs when the light ray just grazes the surface and is refracted out.
Using Pythagorean theorem, tan(theta) = sqrt(3)/3, gives theta = 30 degrees.
The relationship between refractive index n and critical angle theta_c is n = 1/sin(theta_c).
Angle of incidence at critical point is 60 degrees.
Using Snell's law at critical angle, n = 2.
The refractive index of the transparent object is n = 2.
